lines.text: You are so lucky I don't know karate!
Ever wonder whatever happens to the pampered rich kids the liberal arts colleges turn out year after year?
Send me a postcard from skid row.
People say nothing is forever. I say how do you explain herpes or The Grateful Dead?
The bitch about getting older, you know, you don't fling yourself into love and friendships the way you did before you got hurt. That's a damn shame.
Despite your obvious racial handicap, you are an American citizen now, OK, so act like one! We shit all over our families! And then we have kids who grow up to be as big of fuck-ups as we are.
Let's rage at the dying of the light a little bit.
Psychology major right? I love my mother, but not as much as you guys think I do.
It is poetry that will save the world, not commerce.
Art isn't just the vomiting up of adolescent angst.
Mom, dad, you both screwed up your lives. Now back off and give me a chance to screw up mine.
I like you - the kind of like you where I get to see you naked. No more of this palsie walsie stuff.
